title: Dominican Republic: Citi Organizes Meeting for "Women Entrepreneurs" Project
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - Citi Dominican Republic, together with Junior Achievement ADOPEM, leads the project Women Entrepreneurs, which includes elements of business development, financial skills and microfinance that allow women to develop and become economically independent.
tag-1: Dominican Republic: Citi Organizes Meeting for "Women Entrepreneurs" Project
tag-3: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – Citi Dominican Republic, together with Junior Achievement ADOPEM, leads the project Women Entrepreneurs, which includes elements of business development, financial skills and microfinance that allow women to develop and become economically independent.
tag-4: With the intention of supporting the women's efforts, sense of belonging and commitment, the project seeks to develop the entrepreneurial capacity of women and marginalized communities in the Dominican Republic, while encouraging them to use credit responsibly and with solidarity for the development of their families and the community.
tag-5: The project aims to train 1,200 women. Four-hundred-eighteen of them (between 18 and 45 years of age) have already been trained in the early stage of the project. During the month of December, 286 of these women expanded their credit with ADOPEM, and 51 of them opened theirs for the first time. All this was thanks to the training program focused on budget-creation management of personal finances and the importance of saving.
tag-6: "Committed to the communities in which we live and work, at Citi we are proud to be able to help the growth of these families and this society which represent a crucial part of our economy," said Máximo Vidal, CCO Dominican Republic. "Seeing the satisfaction in the faces of these mothers, wives and daughters for having been trained and their pursuit of new goals, is what motivates us to continue providing the necessary tools for the development of the community."
tag-7: Linda Rimer, Senior Vice President of Junior Achievment Worldwide for Latin America and Asia, was also present at the meeting. She traveled to the Dominican Republic to see the project and talked about how its implementation should be a model to be followed in other countries.
tag-8: Paula Lorenzo, one of the women who participated in the program, highlighted the fact they are trained to make effective sales and therefore to establish goals for the improvement of their businesses. She also recognized the way in which the workshop made her see the importance of savings in order to start a new stage of her life, as well as boosting her self-esteem.
tag-9: The meeting was held at ADOPEM's offices, where each woman taking part in the project gave her testimony.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-11: Citi Foundation Citi Foundation is committed to the communities we work for, to economic growth of individuals and families, particularly those most in need, in order to raise their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation assigns its donations strategically to those areas considered a priority: Microfinance and Microbusinesses, Small Businesses, Education, Financial Education and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Microbusinesses, as well as in Small Businesses, to support environmental programs and innovations.
